Enable this option to restore only the: Enable this option to restore only the wp-content folder while ignoring all other WordPress files. This is useful for hosting environments that restrict changes outside the wp-content directory.
Activate passive mode to enhance FTP tra: Activate passive mode to enhance FTP transfer compatibility with firewalls and NAT configurations, ensuring smooth data transfer.
Add internal notes to help identify or d: Add internal notes to help identify or describe this destination.
Allow CLI Access When MFA is Enabled: Allow CLI Access When MFA is Enabled
An unknown state doesn't indicate there: An unknown state doesn't indicate there is an error, it just means that JetBackup cannot read your crontab content from inside WordPress.
Automatically checks your WordPress core: Automatically checks your WordPress core files daily against official checksums to detect unauthorized changes or security issues. You'll receive an email notification if any discrepancies are found. Keep your site secure with minimal effort.
Automatically regenerate Elementor CSS a: Automatically regenerate Elementor CSS after a restore
By default, all site files and database: By default, all site files and database tables are included. You can customize what’s excluded in this job by toggling the Exclude Files or Exclude Tables option. Common Exclusions are enabled by default regardless of your selections for optimal performance; you can adjust this behavior in Settings.
Chunk size refers to the size of each pi: Chunk size refers to the size of each piece of data processed during file operations, such as archiving or reading files. It determines how data is broken into manageable parts for efficient handling. For operations involving remote destinations, the chunk size is managed separately within each destination's settings. Smaller chunks are ideal for handling smaller files or systems with limited resources, while larger chunks are better suited for processing large files efficiently, provided the system has sufficient capacity and stable performance.
Claim your 2GB of free storage now >>: Claim your 2GB of free storage now >>
Clean up revisions before dumping databa: Clean up revisions before dumping databases to reduce backup size and improve performance by removing old edits of posts and pages. Use at your own risk, as this may lead to irreversible data loss.
Clear Autoptimize cache automatically af: Clear Autoptimize cache automatically after a restore
Clear WP Super Cache automatically after: Clear WP Super Cache automatically after a restore
Clear temporary data & Ensure WooCommerc: Clear temporary data & Ensure WooCommerce data integrity after a restore
Click to fetch backup files from the bac: Click to fetch backup files from the backup destination. Availability will be confirmed upon retrieval.
Configure this cron command to ensure yo: Configure this cron command to ensure your backup plugin's background tasks run smoothly every minute. It triggers essential operations like data backup and system synchronization, maintaining your system's integrity without manual intervention. Add this to your crontab to automate the process, ensuring continuous protection and up-to-date backups.
Control which alert levels will trigger: Control which alert levels will trigger email notifications and how frequently they are sent. Alerts will always appear in the GUI regardless of this setting.
Cutting-edge updates with the latest fea: Cutting-edge updates with the latest features and improvements, provided from our repository servers. More stable than Alpha but still may contain bugs. Great for users who prefer to stay at the forefront of development.
Data Directory is used to store configur: Data Directory is used to store configuration and valuable data related to your backups.
Define the directory path on the remote: Define the directory path on the remote server for storing backups. Make sure it’s writable and uniquely identifies the domain (e.g., /backups/domain.com/).
Define the time of day the backup job sh: Define the time of day the backup job should run, based on the schedules you selected. If no schedule is enabled, the job must be run manually. Old backups will be automatically cleaned based on your retention settings.
Defines the maximum time a queued task r: Defines the maximum time a queued task runs before being aborted. Applies to web-based tasks and cannot exceed the server's PHP execution limit. CLI tasks have no time restrictions.
Differences in web server software, such: Differences in web server software, such as Apache vs. Nginx configurations.
Disclaimer: Restoring a backup from anot: Disclaimer: Restoring a backup from another environment can potentially cause issues or result in a fatal error if the environment differs significantly from the current one. Examples include but are not limited to:
Early access to features still in develo: Early access to features still in development, sourced from our repository servers. Expect frequent updates and potential instability. Suitable for developers and testers who want to explore new features.
Email notifications will be sent by defa: Email notifications will be sent by default to the "Admin Email" (set in Settings > General), this will override this option.
Enable SSL encryption to ensure a secure: Enable SSL encryption to ensure a secure and encrypted FTP connection, protecting data during transfer.
Enable one or more destinations to store: Enable one or more destinations to store backups when this job runs. Don’t see your destination? Make sure it’s enabled in the Destinations tab.
Enable or disable JetBackup's independen: Enable or disable JetBackup's independent Backend Heartbeat to trigger scheduled tasks. This operates in parallel with the WordPress Heartbeat API and ensures backups and related tasks run reliably in the background. We recommend keeping both enabled for optimal performance.
Enable or disable JetBackup's integratio: Enable or disable JetBackup's integration with WordPress's internal cron system (WP-Cron). This allows JetBackup tasks to run alongside WordPress's scheduled events. While this method provides flexibility and ease of use, it is less precise than a real server-level cron. For optimal reliability, we recommend keeping this enabled, especially if server-level cron access is unavailable.
Enable post-restore actions for supporte: Enable post-restore actions for supported integrations. These settings ensure proper functionality after a restore operation.
Enable restoring backups created for one: Enable restoring backups created for one domain (e.g., Domain X) on a different domain (e.g., Domain Y). This is useful for migrations but should only be allowed if intentional. By default, this action is restricted to protect against accidental domain mismatches.
Enable this option to access the restore: Enable this option to access the restore file from the plugin’s directory (/wp-content/plugins/backup/restore.php) instead of the default location (mysite.com/restore.php). Use this only if your hosting environment restricts access to the root public path.
Enable\/Disable API to server level JetB: Enable/Disable API to server level JetBackup (Restore backups generated by your hosting provider's JetBackup).
Enable\/Disable Admin top menu bar integ: Enable/Disable Admin top menu bar integration.
Enable\/Disable community languages deli: Enable/Disable community languages delivered by our languages
Enable\/Disable the scheduled cron syste: Enable/Disable the scheduled cron system, including the inability for AJAX calls to trigger cron tasks. This option should only be considered if you plan to manage the cron system exclusively via the wp-cli interface.
Enabling this flag ensures that the back: Enabling this flag ensures that the backup environment is checked against the local system for compatibility. When disabled, the plugin will skip this verification, which may lead to unexpected results or fatal errors during the restore process.
Enabling this will allow command-line op: Enabling this will allow command-line operations even when Multi-Factor Authentication is enabled. This may pose a security risk, as it could permit disabling MFA through CLI without additional verification.
Enhance your account's security by activ: Enhance your account's security by activating Two-Factor Authentication, It's a simple way to prevent unauthorized access and safeguard your data against potential threats.
Ensure that the environments are compati: Ensure that the environments are compatible before proceeding with the restoration.
Enter a recognizable name for your sched: Enter a recognizable name for your schedule.
Enter paths to exclude, one per line (e.g., /wp-content/cache/*)
Enter the hostname or IP address of the: Enter the hostname or IP address of the FTP server you wish to connect to for backup storage. Example: FTP.example.com or 192.0.2.1
Enter the hostname or IP address of the SFTP server you wish to connect to for backup storage. Example: FTP.example.com or 192.0.2.1
Enter the username for authentication wi: Enter the username for authentication with the FTP server. This user must have the necessary permissions to access and write to the specified backup directory.
Enter the username for authentication with the SFTP server. This user must have the necessary permissions to access and write to the specified backup directory.
Enter your backup plugin license key her: Enter your backup plugin license key here to activate premium features, including enhanced backup options and priority support. Ensure your license key is valid and active to maintain uninterrupted access to all benefits.
Failed to load all required data.
File system differences (e.g., restoring: File system differences (e.g., restoring a backup from Windows to Linux).
For optimal safety, please assign 'data: For optimal safety, please assign 'data directory' to a private, non-public location.
Get alerts if backups haven\u2019t run f: Get alerts if backups haven’t run for a specified number of days. Configure the alert email in Settings > Notification.
Give your backup job a clear, descriptiv: Give your backup job a clear, descriptive name (e.g., 'Daily Backups' or 'Database Only'). This name is for internal reference only.
Here is a quick 54 seconds video to get: Here is a quick 54 seconds video to get started with the basics: Backup & Restore!
Hold down the Ctrl (Windows) or Command: Hold down the Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) key to select multiple tables. Excluding a table will backup the structure of the table, not the content of the table.
I understand the risks and confirm that: I understand the risks and confirm that the backup environment matches the current environment as closely as possible.
If the HTTP call (upload \/ download \/: If the HTTP call (upload / download / delete) fails for some reason retry for x times. Maximum 10
Incompatibility in database versions or: Incompatibility in database versions or configurations.
JetBackup Premium Cloud Storage is desig: JetBackup Premium Cloud Storage is designed to work efficiently with JetBackup, providing secure and reliable backups with lightning-fast performance.
JetBackup exports its core config settin: JetBackup exports its core config settings to selected destinations (once a day). Specify the number of exports to keep. Older exports beyond this duration will be automatically deleted. Set this value to 0 to keep exports indefinitely.
JetBackup relies on PHP CLI for backgrou: JetBackup relies on PHP CLI for background operations, here you can set specific path for php binary.
JetBackup server integration is not avai: JetBackup server integration is not available on this system.
JetBackup socket API is not enabled or n: JetBackup socket API is not enabled or not responding on this system
JetBackup will attempt to automatically: JetBackup will attempt to automatically detect the MySQL port from your system settings. If it cannot be determined, this value will be used as the default fallback.
Mismatch in PHP versions between the env: Mismatch in PHP versions between the environments.
Name: Name
Only files\/db related to this site: Only files/db related to this site
Paste your Quick Access Code here: Paste your Quick Access Code here
Placing JetBackup's data directory withi: Placing JetBackup's data directory within the public WordPress directory exposes it to potential security threats.
Please choose your restore preferences. Based on the preferences, your task will be added to the queue for restore preparations. Once it’s ready, you can initiate the restore from the queue page.
Please note that enabling these options: Please note that enabling these options may lead to a slight decrease in system performance and increased use of disk space due to the detailed nature of the logs generated.
Please provide the account_id from the C: Please provide the account_id from the CloudFlare R2 dashboard. (e.g. https://{account_id}.r2.cloudflarestorage.com)
Please select a database restore option.
Please select a files restore option.
Please select the source for your backup: Please select the source for your backup. This determines which destination will be used to restore the backup.
Pre-release versions that are close to t: Pre-release versions that are close to the final stable release, with updates from our repository servers. These versions are intended for final testing before the official release. Recommended for users who wish to test the upcoming stable version and provide feedback.
Provide the password for the specified u: Provide the password for the specified username. Ensure this password is kept secure to prevent unauthorized access to your backups.
Purge W3 Total Cache automatically after: Purge W3 Total Cache automatically after a restore
Receives well-tested updates directly fr: Receives well-tested updates directly from the WordPress repository, ensuring high reliability and minimal risk. Ideal for production environments where stability is paramount.
Restore all files or exclude specific fo: Restore all files or exclude specific folders from the restore.
Restore the entire database or exclude s: Restore the entire database or exclude specific tables from the restore.
Select 'Yes' to ignore self-signed SSL c: Select 'Yes' to ignore self-signed SSL certificates, allowing connections without verifying the certificate's authenticity.
Select a specific site from your multisi: Select a specific site from your multisite network or restore all sites.
Select one or more schedules to automate: Select one or more schedules to automate this backup job. Set the minimum number of backups to retain under each schedule (e.g., keep 7 daily backups).
Select the Heartbeat Time-To-Live (TTL): Select the Heartbeat Time-To-Live (TTL) interval to control the frequency of the backend heartbeat calls. Adjusting this interval can help manage server load. This is not related the WordPress Heartbeat which has it's own independent TTL not controlled by JetBackup.
Select the tables you want to exclude fr: Select the tables you want to exclude from the restore.
Select the type of schedule and its inte: Select the type of schedule and its interval (e.g., daily, weekly).
Select your preferred template panel. Je: Select your preferred template panel. JetBackup will attempt to transform your WordPress backup into the chosen panel format, enabling straightforward restoration within the panel.
Set the default read/write chunk size. Smaller chunks suit small files or slow connections, while larger chunks are better for big files on fast, stable networks.
Set the maximum time (in seconds) the sy: Set the maximum time (in seconds) the system should wait for a connection to the FTP server before timing out. Increase this if you experience connection issues, especially over slow networks.
Set the maximum time (in seconds) the system should wait for a connection to the SFTP server before timing out. Increase this if you experience connection issues, especially over slow networks.
Set to 0 to disable retention and never: Set to 0 to disable retention and never delete backups.
Sets the time-to-live (TTL) for download: Sets the time-to-live (TTL) for downloads. After the specified number of hours, expired items will be automatically deleted. Enter a value in hours, e.g., 72 for 3 days
Specify a custom endpoint for the select: Specify a custom endpoint for the selected vendor.
Specify the number of days to retain log: Specify the number of days to retain log files. Older logs beyond this duration will be automatically deleted. Set this value to 0 to keep logs indefinitely.
Specify the number of times the system s: Specify the number of times the system should attempt to reconnect to the FTP server if the initial connection fails. A higher number of retries can be useful in unstable network conditions.
Specify the number of times the system should attempt to reconnect to the SFTP server if the initial connection fails. A higher number of retries can be useful in unstable network conditions.
Specify the port number used to connect: Specify the port number used to connect to the FTP server. The default FTP port is 21, but this may differ if your server uses a custom configuration.
Specify the port number used to connect to the SFTP server. The default SFTP port is 21, but this may differ if your server uses a custom configuration.
The backup has been successfully extract: The backup has been successfully extracted into a temporary folder. You can now browse and review its contents without affecting the current system state.
This action allows you to lock or unlock: This action allows you to lock or unlock a backup for a selected destination. If locked, the backup cannot be modified or deleted.
This action allows you to mark or unmark: This action allows you to mark or unmark a backup for deletion for a selected destination. Marking for deletion does not immediately delete the backup but flags it for future removal.
This action will clear completed items f: This action will clear completed items from the queue table after a specified number of hours (TTL). Set to 0 to disable this feature.
This action will clear generated system: This action will clear generated system alerts after a specified number of hours (TTL). Set to 0 to disable this feature.
This action will create a download task:
This action will create a download task in the queue, which will archive the selected backup.
Once the archiving process is complete, the download link will be available in the queue page under the download item, allowing you to securely retrieve the backup file.

This action will create a download task in the queue, which will download the selected backup log.
Once the download process is complete, the download link will be available in the queue page under the download item, allowing you to securely retrieve the backup log file.
This action will extract the backup into:
This action will extract the backup into a temporary folder within our working directory (this is not a restore operation).
This is an extraction to allow you to access and review the backup contents without affecting the current system state.
Once the extraction is completed, the path will be available in the queue page under the extract item.
This backup exists on multiple destinati: This backup exists on multiple destinations. Please select the destination you want to apply the changes to.
This backup exists on multiple destinations. Please select the destination you want to download from.
This backup exists on multiple destinations. Please select the destination you want to export from.
This backup exists on multiple destinations. Please select the destination you want to extract from.
This backup exists on multiple destinations. Please select the destination you want to lock or unlock.
This backup exists on multiple destinations. Please select the destination you want to mark or unmark for deletion.
This backup has only one destination:: This backup has only one destination:
This backup log exists on multiple desti: This backup log exists on multiple destinations. Please select the destination you want to download from.
This backup log has only one destination: This backup log has only one destination:
This destination will only allow restore: This destination will only allow restore and download actions. Use it for migration scenarios or when write access isn’t required.
This feature identifies and excludes Wor: This feature identifies and excludes WordPress installations found directly within the first subdirectory level of the main site. It streamlines backups by ignoring nested sites only one level deep, ensuring a focus on your primary WordPress content.
This field cannot be modified for active: This field cannot be modified for active destination
This option will check if destination di: This option will check if destination disk space reached the specified limit before it performs the backup. If you enable this option and available disk space is less than the amount specified, the system will not perform the backup.
This setting controls how many downloads: This setting controls how many downloads can be active at the same time. For example, if set to 2, and there are already 2 active downloads, new downloads cannot be generated until at least one is cleared. Set to 0 to disable this feature.
This setting determines how many manual: This setting determines how many manual backups to keep
Toggle to enable logging of detailed cro: Toggle to enable logging of detailed cron events, helping diagnose timing or execution issues with system tasks.
Toggle to reduce file size and save spac: Toggle to reduce file size and save space at the cost of increased CPU usage, or disable for faster processing with larger file sizes.
Upload your backup file in tar compresse:
Upload your backup file in tar compressed format (.tar or .tar.gz).
This manual restore procedure allows you to use a backup downloaded from an offsite location. Once uploaded, the backup will be prepared for restoration, and you can monitor the upload and restoration progress in the queue for real-time updates.
Usage of server-side caching plugins lik: Usage of server-side caching plugins like Redis or Memcached.
Use our premium cloud storage solution f: Use our premium cloud storage solution for remote backups!
Use this if your hosting provider uses a: Use this if your hosting provider uses a non-default wp-config location
Use this path to browse the extracted fi: Use this path to browse the extracted files.
Utilize the public cron URL to initiate: Utilize the public cron URL to initiate a scheduled task through the web. This unique token for the website ensures access is granted only when the correct token is provided.
When disabled, JetBackup will never send: When disabled, JetBackup will never send email alerts/notifications.
When using simple mode, use the quick ac: When using simple mode, use the quick access code to setup your storage
You can override the default WordPress t: You can override the default WordPress timezone settings by choosing a specific timezone here.
You can use the global wildcard * to mat: You can use the global wildcard * to match any folder or file name. Each entry should be placed on a new line.
You can use wildcards like * to exclude: You can use wildcards like * to exclude multiple files or folders.
Your license status is invalid. Only \"L: Your license status is invalid. Only "Local" and "JetStorage" destinations can be added.
to exclude known temporary tables to enh: to exclude known temporary tables to enhance performance and efficiency of database operations by ignoring temporary or non-essential data. Table structure will be saved without the data.
to skip temporary files from known plugi: to skip temporary files from known plugins. This keeps backups efficient and focused on essential data, enhancing speed and storage management.
